The best description I have of this property, is that it is like a secluded campsite, but instead of staying in a cold leaky tent, you get to stay in a great house with quality appliances and comfy beds (and wifi and cable). The scenery is beautiful and it was incredibly relaxing to sit and be outdoors. The best part, in my opinion, was the privacy. If we would have stayed on the property, the only living things we would have seen were the squirrels, birds, and turkeys that came struggling across the pasture. The house its self was great and the pictures accurately portray it. We had a group of 5, and had more than enough room. I would say that you could comfortably sleep at least 8 or 9 people with everyone on one of the beds, more with the couches.

My only complaint about the entire stay probably doesn't apply to most people, and that is that the fishing on the pond was not great. We still caught 8 Large Mouth Bass, but our hopes when planning the trip were a little higher for the fishing. (Me and my friend who also fished are pretty knowledgeable about fishing and can pretty much catch fish in a swimming pool.) If you want to fish, the most effective baits we found were top waters right before dusk, and small plastic grubs with a spinner attached.
Our group hung out on the dock for hours relaxing and enjoying the beautiful pond and land. Beach towels were provided by the host, and we took full advantage of the bright sun and nice dock. The entire back pasture down to the dock was mowed so we were never in fear of walking in grass we thought there could be snakes. I'm sure this took a lot of work and time, but it was much appreciated.

Again, I will defiantly stay here again, and will recommend it to my friends.
